III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv)Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth’s
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff were emotionally abusive towards a youth and harassed the
youth after they requested to make a CPS complaint. Staff made
condescending remarks when the youth would not follow through
and make a complaint.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via telephone on August 6,
2024, and reported they had no further information.
Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 2 were interviewed face to face
at the facility on August 8, 2024. They both stated Youth A had
been threatening to call Child Protective Services(CPS) several
times but when staff would take him to make the call Youth A
would tell staff he was just kidding or did not want to call.
Supervisor 1 reported one of the times Staff 1 took Youth A to
make the call to CPS, Staff 1 dialed the number and handed the
phone to Youth A. Supervisor 1 described hearing Youth A say
he was kidding and walk away from the phone. Supervisor 1
stated she heard Staff 1 say to Youth A, “you don’t want to talk
now” then Staff 1 talked with CPS on the phone. Supervisor 1 and
Supervisor 2 denied hearing Staff 1 say anything emotionally
abusive or harassing to Youth A.
Director was interviewed face to face at the facility on August
8, 2024. Director reported Youth A often says he would like to call
CPS but seldom follows through with making the call. Director
stated Youth A will say he is just kidding or will not go with staff
when staff take him to the phone to call CPS. Director reported
she was told by Supervisor 1, Youth A wanted to call CPS but
when Staff 1 dialed the phone number Youth A walked away and
Staff 1 said “you don’t want to talk now?” Director denied being
2

told of any concerns about the interaction from Supervisor 1, who
heard the conversation, or Youth A.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on August
8, 2024. Youth A reported he can call CPS any time he requests
to make the call. Youth A described requesting to call CPS, Staff
1 taking him to make the call, dialing the phone and when CPS
answered, Youth A stated he changed his mind and did not want
to report anything. Youth A reported he was not sure why he
changed his mind, he just decided he did not want to talk with
CPS. Youth A stated he has talked with CPS in the past, but this
time decided he did not want to report anything. Youth A stated
Staff 1 talked with CPS and told them Youth A did not want to talk.
Youth A denied Staff 1 harassing him or making any
condescending remarks. Youth A denied making multiple
statements of wanting to call CPS.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on August
8, 2024. Youth B reported he has made calls to CPS and has
never been denied when requested to call. Youth B stated he has
never changed his mind and not called when he has requested.
Youth B reported staff have never said anything to him regarding
CPS. Youth B denied having any concerns with Staff 1 harassing
youth or making condescending remarks.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on August
8, 2024. Youth C stated he requested to call CPS once and was
able to make the call. Youth C reported when youth are upset,
they will say they want to call CPS but then do not follow through
with calling. Youth C denied hearing or seeing Staff 1 harass or
make condescending remarks to any youth.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on August 14, 2024.
Staff 1 described Youth A requesting to call CPS, so she took him
to make the phone call. Staff 1 reported when the CPS
representative answered Youth A did not say anything and tried to
hang up the telephone. Staff 1 stated she got the phone and
apologized to the representative and said Youth A does not want
to talk. Staff 1 stated Youth A frequently says he wants to call
CPS but when staff take him to make the call, he says he does not
want to call. Staff 1 reported this time the call was made but
Youth A did not say anything and tried to hang up the phone.
Staff 1 denied harassing or making condescending remarks to
Youth A. Staff 1 stated she thinks she said something like, “you’re
not going to say anything or talk” to Youth A but that was all she
could recall saying to Youth A.
3

Phone Recording Reviewed:
Phone recording of the call made to Centralized Intake by Youth A
on August 6, 2024, was reviewed. Staff 1 can be heard saying,
“don’t not say nothing, you wanna talk here you go, tell her your
name, say that you’re refusing if you’re not gonna say anything,
tell her you’re refusing.” Staff 1 can be heard saying a client
wanted to call CPS but is now refusing and apologized. Staff 1 is
not heard making condescending remarks or harassing Youth A.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 1’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record.
• Behavior Support and Management Policy: Policy outlines
staff are to provide immediate emotional and environmental
support to clients in crisis in conjunction with Wolverine’s
philosophy of care and treatment. Clients are to be treated
with dignity and respect by all Wolverine Human Services
staff in an environment that is not physically, verbally, and
emotional abusive.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews and phone recording review, Staff 1 was not
emotionally abusive, condescending or harassing toward Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
